note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT
Patient: Ian Murphy  MRN: SYNIP0011  Age/Sex: 65/M
Date: 2025-02-28
Indication: Left mainstem obstruction from metastatic renal cell carcinoma with dyspnea and post-obstructive pneumonia.
Procedure: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of left mainstem tumor.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with rigid bronchoscopy.
Findings: Polypoid vascular tumor arising from lateral wall of proximal left mainstem causing ~80% lumen compromise; purulent secretions distally.
Intervention: Tumor was debulked mechanically using rigid coring, suction, and forceps. A microdebrider was used to excise residual tumor tissue until a near-circular lumen was achieved. Multiple tumor fragments were removed and sent for pathology. Residual narrowing estimated at 25%; no stent placed due to anticipated systemic therapy response.
Complications: Brisk bleeding during initial passes controlled with iced saline, topical epinephrine, and temporary tamponade with the rigid barrel.
Disposition: Remained intubated and transferred to the MICU for overnight observation and treatment of pneumonia.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Left mainstem obstruction from metastatic renal cell carcinoma
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT chest: left mainstem mass with distal consolidation
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Malignant central airway obstruction with post-obstructive pneumonia
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Metastatic renal cell carcinoma to left mainstem bronchus
registry_entry.follow_up_plan: MICU care with antibiotics; repeat bronchoscopy in 72 hours to reassess tumor and secretions.

per_code.summary: Supported by mechanical debulking of left mainstem tumor.

note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT
Patient: Doris Hill  MRN: SYNIP0012  Age/Sex: 74/F
Date: 2025-04-09
Indication: Right bronchus intermedius obstruction from non-small cell lung cancer with recurrent post-obstructive pneumonia.
Procedure: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of tumor in bronchus intermedius.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with rigid bronchoscopy.
Findings: Exophytic tumor in bronchus intermedius just distal to right upper lobe takeoff causing ~75% obstruction with distal mucous plugging.
Intervention: Mechanical debulking was performed using the rigid barrel, suction, and forceps to core out tumor and remove large fragments. A microdebrider was then used to excise residual tumor and smooth the airway wall. Final airway lumen had ~30% residual narrowing; no stent was placed.
Complications: Mild bleeding controlled with cold saline and dilute epinephrine.
Disposition: Extubated in OR and admitted to medical floor for pneumonia management.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Bronchus intermedius obstruction from NSCLC with post-obstructive pneumonia
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT chest: central right lower lobe mass narrowing the bronchus intermedius with distal consolidation
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Malignant central airway obstruction with post-obstructive pneumonia
registry_entry.follow_up_plan: Bronchoscopy in 4–6 weeks to assess for recurrent obstruction; coordination with oncology for systemic therapy.

per_code.summary: Supported by mechanical excision of tumor in the bronchus intermedius.

note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT
Patient: Anthony Green  MRN: SYNIP0013  Age/Sex: 68/M
Date: 2025-03-01
Indication: Distal tracheal tumor with near-critical obstruction and impending respiratory failure.
Procedure: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of tracheal tumor and silicone tracheal stent placement.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with rigid bronchoscopy; anesthesia team present.
Findings: Bulky exophytic tumor at distal trachea extending to carina causing ~95% obstruction; right mainstem partially involved; significant work of breathing pre-procedure.
Intervention: Aggressive mechanical debulking was performed using rigid coring, suction, forceps, and microdebrider until a patent lumen was created. Multiple tumor fragments were removed and sent for histology. A 14 x 40 mm silicone stent was then deployed across the distal tracheal lesion, bridging the carina, with good expansion and coverage. Final lumen showed approximately 30% residual narrowing but robust airflow to both mainstem bronchi.
Complications: Mild bleeding controlled with iced saline and topical epinephrine; no major complications.
Disposition: Remained intubated and transferred to ICU for close airway monitoring.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Near-critical distal tracheal obstruction from endobronchial tumor
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT chest: distal tracheal mass with near-complete occlusion and post-obstructive atelectasis
registry_entry.stent_deployment_method: Rigid bronchoscopy with guidewire and balloon dilation
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Endobronchial carcinoma causing distal tracheal obstruction, debulked and stented
registry_entry.follow_up_plan: ICU monitoring; repeat bronchoscopy in 2–4 weeks for stent assessment and debulking of any recurrent tumor.

cpt_codes.description: Bronchoscopy; with placement of tracheal stent(s)

lines.description: Bronchoscopy; with placement of tracheal stent(s)

per_code.summary: Primary service: aggressive mechanical debulking of tracheal tumor.
Secondary service: placement of silicone tracheal stent.

global_comments: Both excision and stenting are separately reportable when distinct work is performed.

note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT
Patient: Nina Alvarez  MRN: SYNIP0014  Age/Sex: 67/F
Date: 2025-02-05
Indication: Post-radiation polypoid granulation tissue in trachea causing exertional dyspnea and cough.
Procedure: Flexible and rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical resection of tracheal granulation tissue.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with ETT.
Findings: Pedunculated polypoid tissue on anterior tracheal wall ~3 cm above carina causing ~60% narrowing; surrounding mucosa fibrotic.
Intervention: Lesion was grasped and removed using snare resection, followed by microdebrider shaving of residual granulation and rigid coring to smooth the airway. Small fragments were suctioned and sent to pathology. Final lumen with ~15% residual narrowing; no stent placed.
Complications: Minimal bleeding controlled with cold saline.
Disposition: Extubated in OR and discharged to home the same day after observation.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Post-radiation tracheal granulation tissue causing symptomatic narrowing
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT chest: focal anterior tracheal narrowing without mass
registry_entry.bronch_indication: Benign central airway obstruction from granulation tissue
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Benign granulation tissue in trachea, resected
registry_entry.follow_up_plan: Flexible bronchoscopy in 6–8 weeks to evaluate for recurrent granulation tissue.

per_code.summary: Supported by resection of polypoid granulation tissue.

note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT
Patient: James Porter  MRN: SYNIP0015  Age/Sex: 52/M
Date: 2025-04-15
Indication: Left mainstem endobronchial carcinoid tumor discovered on surveillance CT with intermittent hemoptysis.
Procedure: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical excision of carcinoid tumor.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with rigid bronchoscopy.
Findings: Smooth, vascular, pedunculated lesion arising from the medial wall of proximal left mainstem bronchus causing ~65% obstruction; distal lung aerated.
Intervention: Tumor stalk was snared and resected en bloc, followed by rigid coring and microdebrider removal of residual tissue at the base. Margins appeared grossly clear. Specimen sent for histology. Airway lumen restored with ~10–15% residual irregularity.
Complications: Mild bleeding controlled with iced saline and topical epinephrine.
Disposition: Extubated in OR and discharged to ward in stable condition.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Left mainstem carcinoid tumor with partial airway obstruction
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT chest: endobronchial lesion in proximal left mainstem with preserved distal aeration
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Left mainstem typical carcinoid tumor, completely excised bronchoscopically
registry_entry.follow_up_plan: Repeat bronchoscopy and CT in 3 months for surveillance.

per_code.summary: Supported by excision of left mainstem carcinoid tumor.

note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT
Patient: Harriet Cole  MRN: SYNIP0016  Age/Sex: 62/F
Date: 2025-03-19
Indication: Bronchus intermedius tumor with acute worsening dyspnea and wheeze.
Procedure: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of tumor.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with rigid bronchoscopy.
Findings: Irregular friable tumor occupying ~85% of the bronchus intermedius lumen with distal mucous plugging.
Intervention: Tumor was cored out mechanically using the rigid barrel; large fragments were removed with suction and forceps. A microdebrider was used to excise residual tumor along the airway wall. Final lumen with ~30% residual narrowing; no stent was placed due to anticipated systemic therapy.
Complications: Mild bleeding controlled with cold saline and topical epinephrine.
Disposition: Extubated in OR and admitted to oncology ward.

registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT chest: central tumor narrowing bronchus intermedius with right lower lobe collapse
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Endobronchial NSCLC of bronchus intermedius, debulked
registry_entry.follow_up_plan: Bronchoscopy in 4 weeks for reassessment; oncology follow-up for systemic therapy.

per_code.summary: Supported by debulking of bronchus intermedius tumor.

note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT
Patient: Walter Young  MRN: SYNIP0017  Age/Sex: 80/M
Date: 2025-01-30
Indication: Emergent central airway obstruction from endobronchial tumor with acute respiratory distress.
Procedure: Emergent rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of tracheal and carinal tumor.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with rigid bronchoscopy.
Findings: Large friable tumor occupying distal trachea and carina with involvement of right mainstem, causing >90% obstruction; copious secretions.
Intervention: Rapid mechanical debulking using rigid coring, suction, and forceps was performed to remove obstructing tumor bulk. Microdebrider was used to excise residual tumor at carina. Airway patency restored with ~30–40% residual narrowing; no stent placed due to hemodynamic instability and need for short procedure.
Complications: Transient hypotension and tachycardia responded to fluids and vasopressors; bleeding moderate but controlled.
Disposition: Remained intubated and transferred to MICU for continued care.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Emergent central airway obstruction from tracheal/carina tumor
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT chest: large central mass at carina with critical airway compromise
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Central airway tumor at carina, partially debulked
registry_entry.follow_up_plan: MICU care; consider repeat bronchoscopy and stent placement when hemodynamically stabilized.

per_code.summary: Supported by emergent mechanical debulking of carinal tumor.

global_comments: Modifier ET removed from professional billing line as it is informational.

note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT
Patient: Chloe Harris  MRN: SYNIP0018  Age/Sex: 55/F
Date: 2025-02-11
Indication: Right mainstem endobronchial tumor with cough and wheezing, incidentally found on CT.
Procedure: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical excision of right mainstem tumor.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with rigid bronchoscopy.
Findings: Sessile lesion along lateral wall of proximal right mainstem causing ~60% narrowing; no collapse distally.
Intervention: Mechanical debulking using snare resection, rigid coring, and microdebrider was performed. All visible tumor was removed; fragments were sent for histology. Final lumen had ~10% residual irregularity.
Complications: Minimal bleeding; no hypoxia.
Disposition: Extubated in OR and discharged home after observation.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Right mainstem endobronchial lesion with partial obstruction
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT chest: right mainstem endobronchial lesion with preserved distal aeration
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Endobronchial tumor of right mainstem, completely excised
registry_entry.follow_up_plan: Clinic follow-up in 2 weeks; repeat imaging and bronchoscopy in 3 months.

per_code.summary: Supported by excision of right mainstem tumor.

note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT
Patient: Xavier Bennett  MRN: SYNIP0019  Age/Sex: 69/M
Date: 2025-04-01
Indication: Mid-tracheal squamous cell carcinoma with progressive dyspnea and cough.
Procedure: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of mid-tracheal tumor.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with rigid bronchoscopy.
Findings: Fungating mass on posterior mid-tracheal wall causing ~75% narrowing; distal airways patent.
Intervention: Tumor was debulked using rigid coring, snare excision, and microdebrider until a patent lumen was achieved. Multiple tumor fragments were removed and sent to pathology. No stent was placed given adequate residual lumen and planned radiation.
Complications: Mild bleeding controlled with cold saline and dilute epinephrine.
Disposition: Extubated in OR and admitted overnight for observation.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Mid-tracheal squamous cell carcinoma causing symptomatic obstruction
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT chest: focal mid-tracheal mass with airway narrowing
registry_entry.follow_up_plan: Radiation oncology consultation; repeat bronchoscopy in 4–6 weeks.

per_code.summary: Supported by debulking of mid-tracheal tumor.

note_text:
INTERVENTIONAL PULMONOLOGY OPERATIVE REPORT
Patient: Evelyn Ross  MRN: SYNIP0020  Age/Sex: 73/F
Date: 2025-03-10
Indication: Distal tracheal tumor recurrence after chemoradiation with new dyspnea.
Procedure: Rigid bronchoscopy with mechanical debulking of distal tracheal tumor.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with rigid bronchoscopy.
Findings: Irregular nodular tumor at distal trachea just above carina causing ~70% narrowing; prior scar present.
Intervention: Mechanical debulking with rigid coring, microdebrider, and forceps was used to excise tumor tissue and widen the lumen. Multiple fragments removed and sent for pathology. Final lumen with ~25% residual narrowing; no stent placed given adequate caliber and prior radiation changes.
Complications: Mild bleeding; no hypoxia or pneumothorax.
Disposition: Extubated in OR and admitted overnight for observation.

registry_entry.primary_indication: Recurrent distal tracheal tumor after chemoradiation
registry_entry.radiographic_findings: CT chest: focal distal tracheal recurrence with airway narrowing
registry_entry.final_diagnosis_prelim: Recurrent distal tracheal squamous cell carcinoma, debulked
registry_entry.follow_up_plan: Oncology follow-up; consider further systemic therapy; repeat bronchoscopy in 4–6 weeks.

per_code.summary: Supported by debulking of recurrent distal tracheal tumor.
